description: This course provides an examination and application of the key content, skills, and perspectives
of human geography.  The lens of the geographer focuses on the spatial distribution of
phenomena over the surface of the earth, asking the questions "where?" and "why there?".  The
practices and skills of geography are used to investigate a variety of issues in the Middle East,
including environmental problems, the culture and management of sacred places, and the
reasons for war and the need for peace.
Counts toward environmental studies major (social science track).
fullname: Human Geography of the Middle East
